edu.rit.util

Class GpuBigIntArray

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.rit.util.GpuBigIntArray

  • public class GpuBigIntArray
extends java.lang.Object
    Class GpuBigIntArray provides an array of BigInts located on the GPU and mirrored on the CPU.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      BigInt[] item
      Array of BigInts.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      GpuBigIntArray(int bitSize, int len)
      Construct a new bigint array with the given length.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void allocate(Gpu gpu)
      Allocate storage for this bigint array in global memory on the GPU.
      GpuIntArray array()
      Get the underlying int array on the GPU.
      int bitSize()
      Returns the bit size of the bigints in this GPU bigint array.
      void clear()
      Clear this bigint array.
      void devToHost()
      Copy this GPU bigint array from the given GPU device's memory to the host CPU's memory.
      void hostToDev()
      Copy this GPU bigint array from the host CPU's memory to the given GPU device's memory.
      void mirror(Module module, java.lang.String name)
      Set this bigint array to mirror the given global variable on the GPU.
      int wordSize()
      Returns the word size of the bigints in this GPU bigint array.

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • item

        public final BigInt[] item
        Array of BigInts.

    • Constructor Detail

      • GpuBigIntArray

        public GpuBigIntArray(int bitSize,
              int len)
        Construct a new bigint array with the given length. Each element of the array is initialized to a bigint with the given bit size and a value of 0.

        Note: After constructing, call the allocate() or mirror() method to set up storage on the GPU.

        Parameters:
        bitSize - Bit size.
        len - Array length.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if bitSize < 0.
        java.lang.NegativeArraySizeException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if len < 0.

    • Method Detail

      • clear

        public void clear()
        Clear this bigint array. All elements are set to 0.

      • allocate

        public void allocate(Gpu gpu)
        Allocate storage for this bigint array in global memory on the GPU. This bigint array will mirror the allocated storage.
        Parameters:
        gpu - GPU accelerator.
        Throws:
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • mirror

        public void mirror(Module module,
          java.lang.String name)
        Set this bigint array to mirror the given global variable on the GPU.

        Note: It is assumed that the global variable is a uint32_t array with enough elements to hold this bigint array.

        Parameters:
        module - Kernel module object.
        name - Global variable name.
        Throws:
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • array

        public GpuIntArray array()
        Get the underlying int array on the GPU.
        Returns:
        Underlying int array.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the allocate() or mirror() method has not been called.

      • hostToDev

        public void hostToDev()
        Copy this GPU bigint array from the host CPU's memory to the given GPU device's memory.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the allocate() or mirror() method has not been called.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • devToHost

        public void devToHost()
        Copy this GPU bigint array from the given GPU device's memory to the host CPU's memory.
        Throws:
        java.lang.NullPointerException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if the allocate() or mirror() method has not been called.
        GpuException - (unchecked exception) Thrown if a GPU error occurred.

      • wordSize

        public int wordSize()
        Returns the word size of the bigints in this GPU bigint array. This is the number of 32-bit words required to hold each bigint's value.
        Returns:
        Word size.

      • bitSize

        public int bitSize()
        Returns the bit size of the bigints in this GPU bigint array. This is the word size times 32.
        Returns:
        Bit size.
